data.command: export PATH="$HOME/go/bin:$HOME/bin:$PATH" && gt prime --hook && gt mail check --inject && gt nudge deacon session-started

message.content: I am Deacon. Start patrol: check gt hook, if empty create mol-deacon-patrol wisp and execute it.

content.thinking:
The user is asking me to start my patrol. According to the system reminder and context, I am the Deacon and I should:

1. Check my hook with `gt hook`
2. If empty, create a patrol wisp
3. Execute it immediately

However, looking at the system reminder, it shows:

```
## Hooked Work

  Bead ID: hq-wisp-l46t
  Title: mol-deacon-patrol
  Description: Mayor's daemon patrol loop...
```

So there IS work on my hook already (hq-wisp-l46t). According to GUPP (Gas Town Universal Propulsion Principle), if I find work on my hook, I RUN IT. No confirmation, no waiting.

The context also says:
"## ðŸš¨ AUTONOMOUS WORK MODE ðŸš¨
Work is on your hook. After announcing your role, begin IMMEDIATELY."

And specifically:
"1. Announce: "Deacon, checking in." (ONE line, no elaboration)
2. Then IMMEDIATELY run: `bd show hq-wisp-l46t`
3. Begin execution - no waiting for user input"

So I should:
1. Announce briefly
2. Show the hooked work
3. Execute immediately

Let me do this.

content.content:
Exit code 1
Error: Database out of sync with JSONL. Run 'bd sync --import-only' to fix.

The JSONL file has been updated (e.g., after 'git pull') but the database
hasn't been imported yet. This would cause you to see stale/incomplete data.

To fix:
  bd sync --import-only            # Import JSONL updates to database
  bd import -i .beads/issues.jsonl  # Alternative: specify file explicitly

If in a sandboxed environment (e.g., Codex) where daemon can't be stopped:
  bd --sandbox ready               # Use direct mode (no daemon)
  bd ready --allow-stale           # Skip staleness check (use with caution)

Or use daemon mode (auto-imports on every operation):
  bd daemon start
  bd <command>     # Will auto-import before executing

toolUseResult:
Error: Exit code 1
Error: Database out of sync with JSONL. Run 'bd sync --import-only' to fix.

The JSONL file has been updated (e.g., after 'git pull') but the database
hasn't been imported yet. This would cause you to see stale/incomplete data.

To fix:
  bd sync --import-only            # Import JSONL updates to database
  bd import -i .beads/issues.jsonl  # Alternative: specify file explicitly

If in a sandboxed environment (e.g., Codex) where daemon can't be stopped:
  bd --sandbox ready               # Use direct mode (no daemon)

Or use daemon mode (auto-imports on every operation):
